bibl.title: Alcaeus and Antimenidas: Reassessing the Evidence for Greek Mercenaries in the Neo-Babylonian Army.
bibl.note: 1. Alcaeus and Antimenidas. - 2. Strabo's testimony. - 3. Alcaeus and his poems. - 4. Conclusions [Alcaeus fr. 48 = P. Oxy. X, 1233, fr. 11 (= M.-P.3 56; LDAB 169) might allude to his brother fighting with an Egyptian army in defense of Ashkelon, rather than on the Babylonian side]. - 5. Addendum. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Alexander Fantalkin & Ephraim Lytle, Alcaeus and Antimenidas: Reassessing the Evidence for Greek Mercenaries in the Neo-Babylonian Army.

1. Alcaeus and Antimenidas. - 2. Strabo's testimony. - 3. Alcaeus and his poems. - 4. Conclusions [Alcaeus fr. 48 = P. Oxy. X, 1233, fr. 11 (= M.-P.3 56; LDAB 169) might allude to his brother fighting with an Egyptian army in defense of Ashkelon, rather than on the Babylonian side]. - 5. Addendum. - Avec résumé en anglais.
